page.title: 20ARNE'S LIFE,PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: In the nineteenth century smuggling was one of Poole's main industries. Leading merchants both profited and disapproved.They petitioned the Government in 1720 and 1722 to halt smuggling.A few years later they asked for measures to be relaxed as so many people were in prison! Nowadays apart from the farm owners only one person lives and works on Arne;that is the warden of the Nature Reserve whose bungalow is situated opposite the car park.Tourism is an important aspect of Arne but tourists have to walk nearly 3/4 of a mile to reach the beach from the car park, unless they arrive by boat. Contributors;RUTH BAKER,CAROL BATE, JAYNE CHRISTOPHER,SUSAN EVERETT, JOANNE GRAY,ALISON HYLAND,LOUISE SOO-CHAN,JULIA TARRANT,MRS.BULL,MRS. SMITH,MRS.TARRAWAY.
